availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Nicholasville, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary C. Welch. Father of Sarah E. Welch, Thomas Welch, Isabella Welch, and George A. Welch. Owned seven enslaved persons in Jessamine County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Nicholasville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, Division 1, p. 28.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, Nicholasville, p. 29.
Find A Grave, "Nathaniel Welch (January 12, 1821-September 27, 1884)," Memorial #113110198, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/113110198 (accessed April 12, 2018).
